Events.year: 1184 BC – Trojan War: Troy is sacked and burned, according to calculations by Eratosthenes.
Events.html: 1184 BC – Trojan War: Troy is sacked and burned, according to calculations by Eratosthenes.

Events.year: 173 – Marcomannic Wars: The Roman army in Moravia is encircled by the Quadi, who have broken the peace treaty (171). In a violent thunderstorm emperor Marcus Aurelius defeats and subdues them in the so-called "miracle of the rain".
Events.html: 173 – Marcomannic Wars: The Roman army in Moravia is encircled by the Quadi, who have broken the peace treaty (171). In a violent thunderstorm emperor Marcus Aurelius defeats and subdues them in the so-called "miracle of the rain".

Events.year: 631 – Emperor Taizong of Tang, the Emperor of China, sends envoys to the Xueyantuo bearing gold and silk in order to seek the release of enslaved Chinese prisoners captured during the transition from Sui to Tang from the northern frontier; this embassy succeeded in freeing 80,000 Chinese men and women who were then returned to China.
Events.html: 631 – Emperor Taizong of Tang, the Emperor of China, sends envoys to the Xueyantuo bearing gold and silk in order to seek the release of enslaved Chinese prisoners captured during the transition from Sui to Tang from the northern frontier; this embassy succeeded in freeing 80,000 Chinese men and women who were then returned to China.

Events.year: 786 – A Hasanid Alid uprising in Mecca is crushed by the Abbasids at the Battle of Fakhkh. Idris ibn Abdallah flees to the Maghreb, where he later founds the Idrisid dynasty.
Events.html: 786 – A Hasanid Alid uprising in Mecca is crushed by the Abbasids at the Battle of Fakhkh. Idris ibn Abdallah flees to the Maghreb, where he later founds the Idrisid dynasty.

Events.year: 980 – Vladimir the Great consolidates the Kievan realm from Ukraine to the Baltic Sea. He is proclaimed ruler (knyaz) of all Kievan Rus'.
Events.html: 980 – Vladimir the Great consolidates the Kievan realm from Ukraine to the Baltic Sea. He is proclaimed ruler (knyaz) of all Kievan Rus'.

Events.year: 1011 – Lombard Revolt: Greek citizens of Bari rise up against the Lombard rebels led by Melus and deliver the city to Basil Mesardonites, Byzantine governor (catepan) of the Catepanate of Italy.
Events.html: 1011 – Lombard Revolt: Greek citizens of Bari rise up against the Lombard rebels led by Melus and deliver the city to Basil Mesardonites, Byzantine governor (catepan) of the Catepanate of Italy.

Events.year: 1118 – Roger of Salerno, Prince of Antioch, captures Azaz from the Seljuk Turks.
Events.html: 1118 – Roger of Salerno, Prince of Antioch, captures Azaz from the Seljuk Turks.

Events.year: 1157 – Albert I of Brandenburg, also called The Bear (Ger: Albrecht der Bär), becomes the founder of the Margraviate of Brandenburg, Germany and the first margrave.
Events.html: 1157 – Albert I of Brandenburg, also called The Bear (Ger: Albrecht der Bär), becomes the founder of the Margraviate of Brandenburg, Germany and the first margrave.

Events.year: 1345 – The megas doux Alexios Apokaukos, chief minister of the Byzantine Empire, is lynched by political prisoners.
Events.html: 1345 – The megas doux Alexios Apokaukos, chief minister of the Byzantine Empire, is lynched by political prisoners.

Events.year: 1429 – Hundred Years' War: Start of the Battle of Jargeau.
Events.html: 1429 – Hundred Years' War: Start of the Battle of Jargeau.

Events.year: 1488 – Battle of Sauchieburn: Fought between rebel Lords and James III of Scotland, resulting in the death of the king.
Events.html: 1488 – Battle of Sauchieburn: Fought between rebel Lords and James III of Scotland, resulting in the death of the king.

Events.year: 1509 – Henry VIII of England marries Catherine of Aragon.
Events.html: 1509 – Henry VIII of England marries Catherine of Aragon.

Events.year: 1594 – Philip II recognizes the rights and privileges of the local nobles and chieftains in the Philippines, which paved way to the stabilization of the rule of the Principalía (an elite ruling class of native nobility in Spanish Philippines).
Events.html: 1594 – Philip II recognizes the rights and privileges of the local nobles and chieftains in the Philippines, which paved way to the stabilization of the rule of the Principalía (an elite ruling class of native nobility in Spanish Philippines).

Events.year: 1748 – Denmark adopts the characteristic Nordic Cross flag later taken up by all other Scandinavian countries.
Events.html: 1748 – Denmark adopts the characteristic Nordic Cross flag later taken up by all other Scandinavian countries.

Events.year: 1770 – British explorer Captain James Cook runs aground on the Great Barrier Reef.
Events.html: 1770 – British explorer Captain James Cook runs aground on the Great Barrier Reef.

Events.year: 1775 – The American Revolutionary War's first naval engagement, the Battle of Machias, results in the capture of a small British naval vessel.
Events.html: 1775 – The American Revolutionary War's first naval engagement, the Battle of Machias, results in the capture of a small British naval vessel.

Events.year: 1776 – The Continental Congress appoints Thomas Jefferson, John Adams, Benjamin Franklin, Roger Sherman, and Robert R. Livingston to the Committee of Five to draft a declaration of independence.
Events.html: 1776 – The Continental Congress appoints Thomas Jefferson, John Adams, Benjamin Franklin, Roger Sherman, and Robert R. Livingston to the Committee of Five to draft a declaration of independence.

Events.year: 1788 – Russian explorer Gerasim Izmailov reaches Alaska.
Events.html: 1788 – Russian explorer Gerasim Izmailov reaches Alaska.

Events.year: 1805 – A fire consumes large portions of Detroit in the Michigan Territory.
Events.html: 1805 – A fire consumes large portions of Detroit in the Michigan Territory.

Events.year: 1825 – The first cornerstone is laid for Fort Hamilton in New York City.
Events.html: 1825 – The first cornerstone is laid for Fort Hamilton in New York City.

Events.year: 1837 – The Broad Street Riot occurs in Boston, fueled by ethnic tensions between Yankees and Irish.
Events.html: 1837 – The Broad Street Riot occurs in Boston, fueled by ethnic tensions between Yankees and Irish.

Events.year: 1865 – The Naval Battle of the Riachuelo is fought on the rivulet Riachuelo (Argentina), between the Paraguayan Navy on one side and the Brazilian Navy on the other. The Brazilian victory was crucial for the later success of the Triple Alliance (Brazil, Uruguay, and Argentina) in the Paraguayan War.

The Brazilian victory was crucial for the later success of the Triple Alliance (Brazil, Uruguay, and Argentina) in the Paraguayan War.

Events.year: 1892 – The Limelight Department, one of the world's first film studios, is officially established in Melbourne, Australia.
Events.html: 1892 – The Limelight Department, one of the world's first film studios, is officially established in Melbourne, Australia.

Events.year: 1895 – Paris-Bordeaux-Paris, sometimes called the first automobile race in history or the "first motor race", takes place.
Events.html: 1895 – Paris-Bordeaux-Paris, sometimes called the first automobile race in history or the "first motor race", takes place.

Events.year: 1898 – The Hundred Days' Reform, a planned movement to reform social, political, and educational institutions in China, is started by the Guangxu Emperor, but is suspended by Empress Dowager Cixi after 104 days. (The failed reform led to the abolition of the Imperial examination in 1905.)
Events.html: 1898 – The Hundred Days' Reform, a planned movement to reform social, political, and educational institutions in China, is started by the Guangxu Emperor, but is suspended by Empress Dowager Cixi after 104 days. (The failed reform led to the abolition of the Imperial examination in 1905.)

Events.year: 1901 – The boundaries of the Colony of New Zealand are extended by the UK to include the Cook Islands.
Events.html: 1901 – The boundaries of the Colony of New Zealand are extended by the UK to include the Cook Islands.

Events.year: 1903 – A group of Serbian officers stormed the royal palace and assassinated King Alexander Obrenović and his wife, Queen Draga.
Events.html: 1903 – A group of Serbian officers stormed the royal palace and assassinated King Alexander Obrenović and his wife, Queen Draga.

Events.year: 1917 – King Alexander assumes the throne of Greece after his father, Constantine I, abdicates under pressure from allied armies occupying Athens.
Events.html: 1917 – King Alexander assumes the throne of Greece after his father, Constantine I, abdicates under pressure from allied armies occupying Athens.

Events.year: 1919 – Sir Barton wins the Belmont Stakes, becoming the first horse to win the U.S. Triple Crown.
Events.html: 1919 – Sir Barton wins the Belmont Stakes, becoming the first horse to win the U.S. Triple Crown.

Events.year: 1920 – During the U.S. Republican National Convention in Chicago, U.S. Republican Party leaders gathered in a room at the Blackstone Hotel to come to a consensus on their candidate for the U.S. presidential election, leading the Associated Press to coin the political phrase "smoke-filled room".
Events.html: 1920 – During the U.S. Republican National Convention in Chicago, U.S. Republican Party leaders gathered in a room at the Blackstone Hotel to come to a consensus on their candidate for the U.S. presidential election, leading the Associated Press to coin the political phrase "smoke-filled room".

Events.year: 1935 – Inventor Edwin Armstrong gives the first public demonstration of FM broadcasting in the United States at Alpine, New Jersey.
Events.html: 1935 – Inventor Edwin Armstrong gives the first public demonstration of FM broadcasting in the United States at Alpine, New Jersey.

Events.year: 1936 – The London International Surrealist Exhibition opens.
Events.html: 1936 – The London International Surrealist Exhibition opens.

Events.year: 1937 – Great Purge: The Soviet Union under Joseph Stalin executes eight army leaders.
Events.html: 1937 – Great Purge: The Soviet Union under Joseph Stalin executes eight army leaders.

Events.year: 1938 – Second Sino-Japanese War: The Battle of Wuhan starts.
Events.html: 1938 – Second Sino-Japanese War: The Battle of Wuhan starts.

Events.year: 1942 – World War II: The United States agrees to send Lend-Lease aid to the Soviet Union.
Events.html: 1942 – World War II: The United States agrees to send Lend-Lease aid to the Soviet Union.

Events.year: 1942  – Free French Forces retreat from Bir Hakeim after having successfully delayed the Axis advance.
Events.html: 1942 – Free French Forces retreat from Bir Hakeim after having successfully delayed the Axis advance.

Events.year: 1944 – USS Missouri, the last battleship built by the United States Navy and future site of the signing of the Japanese Instrument of Surrender, is commissioned.
Events.html: 1944 – USS Missouri, the last battleship built by the United States Navy and future site of the signing of the Japanese Instrument of Surrender, is commissioned.

Events.year: 1955 – Eighty-three spectators are killed and at least 100 are injured after an Austin-Healey and a Mercedes-Benz collide at the 24 Hours of Le Mans, the deadliest ever accident in motorsports.
Events.html: 1955 – Eighty-three spectators are killed and at least 100 are injured after an Austin-Healey and a Mercedes-Benz collide at the 24 Hours of Le Mans, the deadliest ever accident in motorsports.

Events.year: 1956 – Start of Gal Oya riots, the first reported ethnic riots that target minority Sri Lankan Tamils in the Eastern Province. The total number of deaths is reportedly 150.
Events.html: 1956 – Start of Gal Oya riots, the first reported ethnic riots that target minority Sri Lankan Tamils in the Eastern Province. The total number of deaths is reportedly 150.

Events.year: 1962 – Frank Morris, John Anglin and Clarence Anglin allegedly become the only prisoners to escape from the prison on Alcatraz Island.
Events.html: 1962 – Frank Morris, John Anglin and Clarence Anglin allegedly become the only prisoners to escape from the prison on Alcatraz Island.

Events.year: 1963 – American Civil Rights Movement: Governor of Alabama George Wallace defiantly stands at the door of Foster Auditorium at the University of Alabama in an attempt to block two black students, Vivian Malone and James Hood, from attending that school. Later in the day, accompanied by federalized National Guard troops, they are able to register.
Events.html: 1963 – American Civil Rights Movement: Governor of Alabama George Wallace defiantly stands at the door of Foster Auditorium at the University of Alabama in an attempt to block two black students, Vivian Malone and James Hood, from attending that school. Later in the day, accompanied by federalized National Guard troops, they are able to register.

Events.year: 1963  – Buddhist monk Thích Quảng Đức burns himself with gasoline in a busy Saigon intersection to protest the lack of religious freedom in South Vietnam.
Events.html: 1963 – Buddhist monk Thích Quảng Đức burns himself with gasoline in a busy Saigon intersection to protest the lack of religious freedom in South Vietnam.

Events.year: 1963  – John F. Kennedy addresses Americans from the Oval Office proposing the Civil Rights Act of 1964, which would revolutionize American society by guaranteeing equal access to public facilities, ending segregation in education, and guaranteeing federal protection for voting rights.
Events.html: 1963 – John F. Kennedy addresses Americans from the Oval Office proposing the Civil Rights Act of 1964, which would revolutionize American society by guaranteeing equal access to public facilities, ending segregation in education, and guaranteeing federal protection for voting rights.

Events.year: 1964 – World War II veteran Walter Seifert attacks an elementary school in Cologne, Germany, killing at least eight children and two teachers and seriously injuring several more with a home-made flamethrower and a lance.
Events.html: 1964 – World War II veteran Walter Seifert attacks an elementary school in Cologne, Germany, killing at least eight children and two teachers and seriously injuring several more with a home-made flamethrower and a lance.

Events.html: 1968 – Lloyd J. Old identified the first cell surface antigens that could differentiate among different cell types.
